Operation 'getFlightsStatus' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. The current summary is vague and doesn't reflect the API's primary purpose (flight status). The description is completely empty, providing no guidance for AI agents on what inputs are expected, what data is returned, or when to use this operation. The improved version clarifies that this retrieves flight status (not just generic flight data), explains the expected parameters based on the API's schema context (FlightDesignator, Timing, Departure, Arrival), specifies the return data types (gate, terminal, timing information), and provides context for AI agent decision-making about when to invoke this operation.

data.current_summary: Retrieves a unique flight by search criteria.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve flight status by search criteria
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the current status of one or more flights based on provided search criteria. Accepts parameters such as flight designator (airline code and flight number), departure date, and airport codes to identify specific flights. Returns detailed flight status information including departure and arrival times, gate assignments, terminal information, and any operational issues or delays. This operation is useful for tracking real-time flight information and monitoring schedule changes.
